text: Presidential elections were held in Slovakia on 15 May 1999, with a second round on 29 May.Nohlen, D & Stöver, P (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1747 Following a constitutional amendment in 1998 that introduced direct presidential elections for the first time,Nohlen & Stöver, p1740 they resulted in a victory for Rudolf Schuster, who received 57.2% of the vote in the run-off.Nohlen & Stöver, p1755 ==Results== Results of the first round of the election, showing vote strength by district. Results of the second round of the election, showing vote strength by district. {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !rowspan=2|Candidate !rowspan=2|Party !colspan=2|First round !colspan=2|Second round |- !Votes !% !Votes !% |- |align=left|Rudolf Schuster||align=left|Party of Civic Understanding||1,396,950||47.4||1,727,481||57.2 |- |align=left|Vladimír Mečiar||align=left|Movement for a Democratic Slovakia||1,097,956||37.2||1,293,642||42.8 |- |align=left|Magdaléna Vášáryová|| ||194,635||6.6||colspan=2 rowspan=8| |- |align=left|Ivan Mjartan|| ||105,903||3.6 |- |align=left|Ján Slota||align=left|Slovak National Party||73,836||2.5 |- |align=left|Boris Zala|| ||29,697||1.0 |- |align=left|Juraj Švec|| ||24,077||0.8 |- |align=left|Juraj Lazarčík|| ||15,386||0.5 |- |align=left|Michal Kováč|| ||5,425||0.2 |- |align=left|Ján Demikát|| ||4,537||0.2 |- |align=left colspan=2|Invalid/blank votes||36,022||–||28,098||– |- |align=left colspan=2|Total||2,984,424||100||3,049,221||100 |- |align=left colspan=2|Registered voters/turnout||4,038,899||73.9||4,041,181||75.5 |- |align=left colspan=6|Source: Nohlen & Stöver |} Kováč withdrew from the election, but remained on the ballot paper. ==References== ==External links== *Tables of official results Category:Presidential elections in Slovakia Slovakia Category:1999 in Slovakia Category:May 1999 events in Europe
title: 1999 Slovak presidential election
